data.text:
Nintendo's Animal Crossing is a gorgeous game. This game is much easier than it appears. The controls are basic, and no particular skills or knowledge is required to play the game. Simply play the game a few times to get acclimated to the controls, and you'll be ready to use your favorite characters in Animal Crossing: New Horizons.

But there is only one drawback: it is only available on the Nintendo Switch. Unfortunately, the vast majority of casual gamers do not own a Switch and instead prefer to play on PCs. So will PC users ever be able to socialize on Animal Crossing's famous island?

What is Animal Crossing: New Horizons?

Animal Crossing: New Horizons is the fifth main entry in the Animal Crossing series, developed and published by Nintendo for the Nintendo Switch. It was launched in 2020 and has since gone on to become one of the series' standout games as well as the 16th best-selling video game in history. Gamers take on the role of a villager who has relocated to a deserted island, where the game progresses in a non-linear fashion, allowing the player to play as they like.

They are free to develop the island any way they see appropriate, with the help of anthropomorphic villagers. Not only that, but the game also allows both local and online co-op action, with up to four local players and eight online players able to occupy an island.

Is it possible to play Animal Crossing: New Horizons on the PC?

Yes, it is possible although the methods are a little murky at best. The best possible way would be to use an emulator that allows one to play the game on a PC although applications that will enable gamers to mirror their screens can also be used to play Animal Crossing: New Horizons on the PC.

How to play Animal Crossing: New Horizons on the PC?

While there are various ways to play Animal Crossing: New Horizons on the PC, the Ryujinx emulator is the best option. It is an open-source application that is available on a variety of platforms, including Windows. It also enables users to play Nintendo games on PC with outstanding precision and performance. Amazingly, this emulator is straightforward to use. Follow the steps below to discover how to use this software to play Animal Crossing New Horizons on PC.

To begin, get Ryujinx Switch Emulator from its official website. Then, save the Animal Crossing installer in.XCI or.NSP format.

After that, extract the file and install the emulator and game. Once that is done, start the emulator. Install the product keys this time by clicking the "File" button and opening the Ryujinx folder.

Drag & drop the product keys into the "System" folder from there. After that, restart the emulator and then proceed to the settings by clicking the "Options" button.

Then, to add Animal Crossing New Horizons to your computer, click the "Add" button.

After you've selected the game file, click "Input" to configure your game controls. Once finished, click the "Save" button. After that, you'll be able to play Animal Crossing New Horizons on PC with ease.

FAQs

Q. What is the whole point of Animal Crossing: New Horizons?

A. For several Animal Crossing: New Horizons players, the whole point of playing the game is friendship. The Nintendo series has long allowed users to connect with real-life pals as well as anthropomorphic animals.

Q. Is Animal Crossing: New Horizons the same as Animal Crossing?

A. The first Animal Crossing began in a random open town with new animal pals and lacked any sort of logic. In contrast, New Horizons has a getaway island where everything is explained and can be personalized.
